Focus on a 2x2 matrix to compute some measure(s).

Source: R/comp_mlm.R
mlm_focus.Rd

mlm_focus adopts particular perspectives on a 2x2 matrix mx to compute various scientific measures.

mlm_focus(mx, measures = c("all"), as_pc = FALSE, n_digits = 3)

Arguments

mx

A 2x2 matrix (as numeric contingency table, required).

measures

A vector of the measure(s) to compute. Default: measures = c("all") (i.e., all available measures).

as_pc

Boolean: Convert probabilities into percentages? Default: as_pc = FALSE.

n_digits

Number of decimal places to which result is rounded. Default: n_digits = 3.

Value

A named numeric vector.

Details

If no subset of measures is specified, mlm_focus computes the 36 measures for a 2x2 matrix mx that are contained in Table 3 of Neth et al., (2021) (https://doi.org/10.3389/fpsyg.2020.567817).

See also

mlm_frame creates a 2x2 matrix; mlm_trans converts a 2x2 matrix (into a table of probabilities/conditional probabilities); is_matrix verifies a 2x2 matrix.

Other matrix lens model functions: mlm_frame(), mlm_trans()

Examples

# 1. The mammography problem:
abcd <- c(8, 95, 2, 895)  # Frequencies (Gigerenzer & Hoffrage, 1995)
mp <- mlm_frame(data = abcd, x = "Condition", y = "Test",
            x_levels = c("cancer", "no cancer"),
            y_levels = c("positive", "negative"))
#> mlm_frame (case 3): Creating mx from frequency counts (abcd) and layout description

# 1. Computing ALL measures at once (and selecting afterwards):
mlm_focus(mp)
#>              TP              FP              FN              TN            prev 
#>           8.000          95.000           2.000         895.000           0.010 
#>            bias             Acc            sens             fpr             fnr 
#>           0.103           0.903           0.800           0.096           0.200 
#>            spec             PPV             FDR             FOR             NPV 
#>           0.904           0.078           0.922           0.002           0.998 
#>         Jaccard              F1              G2            lift              RI 
#>           0.076           0.142           0.249           7.767           0.007 
#>             dPc             NNT            BACC             RRR             dPr 
#>           0.704           1.420           0.852           7.337           0.009 
#>           kappa             MCC             Chi   pre-test odds post-test odds+ 
#>           0.000           0.230          53.113           0.010           0.084 
#> post-test odds-             LR+             LR-             DOR               Q 
#>           0.002           8.337           0.221          37.684           0.948 
#>               Y 
#>           0.720 
mlm_focus(mp)["PPV"]
#>   PPV 
#> 0.078 
mlm_focus(mp)[c("dPc", "dPr", "Chi")]
#>    dPc    dPr    Chi 
#>  0.704  0.009 53.113 

# 2. Computing individual measures:
# 4 frequencies:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("TP", "fp", "fn", "TN"))
#>  TP  fp  fn  TN 
#>   8  95   2 895 
sum(mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("TP", "fp", "fn", "TN")))  # N
#> [1] 1000

# 3 marginal probabilities:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("prev", "bias", "Acc"))
#>  prev  bias   Acc 
#> 0.010 0.103 0.903 

# 8 conditional probabilities:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("sens", "fpr", "fnr", "spec"))  # X/by-col
#>  sens   fpr   fnr  spec 
#> 0.800 0.096 0.200 0.904 
mlm_trans(mp, margin = 2)
#>           Condition
#> Test       cancer no cancer
#>   positive  0.800     0.096
#>   negative  0.200     0.904
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("PPV", "FDR", "FOR", "NPV"))    # Y/by-row
#>   PPV   FDR   FOR   NPV 
#> 0.078 0.922 0.002 0.998 
mlm_trans(mp, margin = 1)
#>           Condition
#> Test       cancer no cancer
#>   positive  0.078     0.922
#>   negative  0.002     0.998

# 3 triangular measures:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("Jaccard", "F1", "G2"))
#> Jaccard      F1      G2 
#>   0.076   0.142   0.249 
# 2 mixed scores:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("lift", "RI"))
#>  lift    RI 
#> 7.767 0.007 

# 8 difference-based measures:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("dPc", "NNT", "BACC", "RRR",
                       "dPr", "kappa", "MCC", "Chi"))
#>    dPc    NNT   BACC    RRR    dPr  kappa    MCC    Chi 
#>  0.704  1.420  0.852  7.337  0.009  0.000  0.230 53.113 

# 3 simple odds:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("pre-test odds", "post-test odds+", "post-test odds-"))
#>   pre-test odds post-test odds+ post-test odds- 
#>           0.010           0.084           0.002 

# 5 odds ratios:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("LR+", "LR-", "DOR", "Q", "Y"))
#>    LR+    LR-    DOR      Q      Y 
#>  8.337  0.221 37.684  0.948  0.720 

# Typical uses:
mlm_focus(mp, measures = c("sens", "spec", "ppv", "npv"))
#>  sens  spec   ppv   npv 
#> 0.800 0.904 0.078 0.998
